intro: Hieraciodes racemifera, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in the spring and summer, producing blue to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in cooler climates.
